text: Feria Tertia De Letania Maioremen ða leofestan þys syndon halige dagas and halwendlice us to begangenne and to healdenne þurh rihtne geleafan mid fæstenum and mid ælmessylenum, swa urum sawlum nydþearflic is.

Utan geþencan hu ælmihtig God for us þrowode and geþafode: ærest þa he wæs on heofona rices hyhðu up ahafen and on his wuldre unonwendedlic, þa geeadmette he hine to þan þæt he syðþan on þisne middaneard wæs acenned and to menn geworden.

And he ða her on worulde wæs þrowigendlic monn, and gyt he hine sylfne geeadmette to þon þæt he wolde for mancynnes þearfe geþrowian and hine sylfne lætan for ealles middaneardes are and alysnesse ahon and acwellan.

Ærest he þæt geþafode his agenum willan, þæt hine mann for ure þearfe genam and geband, and he wæs mid swipum beswungen and hine man on þæt neb hræhte, and hine man mid bradum handum on þæt neb sloh and him þyrnene helm for oðerne cynehelm on þæt heafod sette.

And eall he þæt eadmodlice for ure þearfe geþrowode and micle maran and mænigfealdre þing þonne ic nu on þisse hwile areccan mæge oððe asecgan, þa þe he for mancynnes hælo and are on him sylfum aræfnode and forbær.

And þæt her ealra mæst is, swa ic ær sæde, þæt hine man for ure ealra neodþearfe and for ealles middaneardes alysednysse on rode <gealgan> aheng and gefæstnode; and hine man eac þær mid spere gewundode.
And he þa his þæt halige heafod onhylde and his gast on his Fæder hand ageaf and on his geweald bebead.

And eac to helwarum nyþer astah and ðone ealdan wiðerweardan feond þær geband and getigde; and mænige halige sawla þæra manna þe him ær her on worulde gehyrdon and gecwemdon he þonon up ateah to heofona rices hyhðo and to his wuldre gelædde.

Forðon, men <þa> <leofestan>, us is swyðe mycel þearf þæt we ealle þa þing geþencan and asmeagan geornlice and eadmodlice, and him þæs symle inweardlice þancas secgan ealra þæra þinga þe he for mancynnes þearfe mildelice on him sylfum forbær and geþrowode.
And we symle geornlice his þa halgan and þa godcundan bebodu agan to gefyllanne and to gehealdenne on us sylfum.

Ne syndon nænie on þissere worulde ne on þissum life þæs fæstlice and ðæs mislice þing þæt hi symle fullhrædlice aweg ne gewitan; þonne bið þæt swyðe scandlic and swyðe bysmorlic þæt man þæt lufige and on þam hangie þe he gesyhð þæt him daga gehwylce fram higeð and efsteð.

Ac uton we micle swyðor habban godcunde lufe betwyx us; forðam þe ic sæde <ær>, for urum lufon ealles middaneardes fruma and ende to þissere eorðan astah, and þa eac on þissere worulde for urum lufon deað þrowode and on him sylfum aræfnode.

Uton we þonne forðon, men þa leofestan, geornlice tiligean þæt we for his lufe and for his willan us sylfe and ures lichaman lustas and willan on us sylfum cwylmen, and þæt we eac for his lufon and for his willan ealle þa lustfulnessa þissere andweardan tide and þissere gewitendan forseon and forhycgan, þæt we of ðam wacran and of þam wyrsan to þam beteran and to þam selran becuman moton, of ðissum lichamlicum þingum to þam godcundan, and of þisses middaneardes life to his gesælignysse and to þam hihte þæs toweardan lifes and þæs ecan æristes becuman magan and moton.
Ac utan hyhtan us and þeodan us to ælmihtigum Gode and to his are and to his forgyfnysse.

Forðon se sealmscop þæt lærde and swa cwæð, Cumað ge and uton us gebiddan and forðgangan beforan ælmihtigum Gode and hreowsian for urum synnum and mandædum; and don we godcunde gyfe to ðon þæt we Godes are and his miltse begytan magon and moton.

And uton aweorpan fram us þone yfelan and ðone grimman gewunan and us mid godcunde mægne gearwian, þæt we þæt heofoncunde lif geearnian magon, and þæt we ne þurfon beon Gode on þa wynstran hand gesette ne þone cwyde gehyran þe he to þam cwyð.
leofan men, ac efston we mid fæstenum and mid ælmesdædum þæt us seo hell ne forswelge.
God ælmihtig is swyðe mildheort and manþwære.

Ac hwæðere he on domesdæg byð swyðe reþe and swyðe rihtwis; and þy he bið domesdæg gehaten forþan ðe Drihten sylf on þæm dæge demeð eallum eorðwarum, þa þe he ær sylfa hider gescop and geworhte, swa hwæðer swa hi on þissere worulde ær geworhton swa heofona rice swa hellewite.

Send þonne his englas to feower dælum þisses middaneardes and ðær his ða heofoncundan byman blawað, and þonne ealle eorðware up arisað of ðæm ealdum eorðscræfum and of ðæm ealdum eorðdenum þe we on gehydde wæron.

Þonne bið eal þes middaneard swyðe onhrered and onstyred; duna myltað swa weax deð on fyre, sæs beoð adrugode and steorran hreosað of heofonum swa snaw deþ on eorðan þonne hit swyðost sniwoð, and stanas formyltað, and seo sunne bið on þeostru gecyrred and se mona ne sylð nænne sciman of him, and seo heofon bið toborsten fram eastdæle middaneardes oð þone westdæl, and ðonne ealle heofonwaru and eorðwaru beoð swyðe forhte gewordene.
And þonne oðre siðe ure Drihten hider on þisne middaneard becymeð to demanne mid mycelre menio engla and heahengla, apostola and martyra.
And he þonne his þæt heofonlice werod him on þa swyðran healfe gesetteð and þa manfullan beoð on þa wynstran healfe gecyrred.

And he þonne on his fotum and on his handum þa dolhswaþu forð æteoweð, and ðus sprecende bið and ðus cwyð, Eala, þu man, forhwon noldest þu þas wunda gelacnian þas ic for ðe þafiende wæs, to þon þæt ic ealle þine wunda gelacnode?
Oððe forhwan noldest ðu þysne þyrnenan helm me of þæm heafde alysan, to þan þæt ic ðe of hellehæfte nearwan alysde and of deofles anwealde?

And he þonne eft oðre siðe swyðe mycclum and swyðe reðum wordum <sprecende> bið to þæm þe him on þa wynstran healfe gesette byð and ðus cwyð, Gewitað ge, awyrgedan gastas, fram me in þæt forwyrde lif and in þa nyðemestan helle, of þissum godcundan gemanan, on deofla gemanan and of þissum heofonlican heape in þone hellican þreat.
Ne cweð he þonne na þæt eow wæs gegearwod fram fruman þisses middaneardes, ac he cwyð þæt wæs gegearwod fram fruman þisses middaneardes deoflum and his gescolum.

Ðær is þonne heof and wop and cyrm and granung and cwanung and toða gristbitung, and ðær is seo singale niht, and ðær syndon þa ecan þystru and ðær ne bið næfre nænig leoht geseald; ac þær bið se hearda hungor and se bitera þurst.

And ðær is wanunga and wita ma þonne æniges mannes earan ahlystan magon ne nanes mannes tunga nis to þam swyft, þeah þe <he> hæbbe XII heafdu and ðæra heafdu æghwylc hæbbe XII tungan and ðæra tunga æghwylc hæbbe XII stefna and ðæra stefna gehwylc hæbbe snyttro Salomones; ne magon hi þeahhwæðere ealle þa wean and ða witu ariman ne areccan þe þa earman and ða werigan sawla geþafian and þrowian sculon.
And nan þæra wita mare ne byð þonne þæt ure Drihten him næfre eft on gemyndum ne byð ne ne becymð.
þæt is yrres dæg and <æfstes> dæg and þæt is susle dæg and þæt is se bitera bifigenda dæg and se cwacienda dæg and se forhtigenda domesdæg.

Tylian we nu forðon, men þa leofestan, mid fæstenum and mid ælmesdædum and mid cyriclicum wæccum and socnum and mid eorðlicum leohte, þæt we magon and moton æt þam ælmihtigan Gode geearnian þæt we moton on domesdæge beon on his swyðran healfe gesette and þone cwyde gehyran þe he to þam <cweð> þe þonne on his swyðran gesette beoð.
He cweð, Cumað ge gebletsode, þe mine bebodu heoldon, and onfoð freolice mines Fæder rice þæt eow wæs fram fruman þisses middaneardes togeanes gegearwod.

Geunne us þonne se ælmihtiga God þæt we to ðam heofonlican eþle becuman magon and moton, þær he leofað and ricsað mid Fæder and Suna and mid þam Halgan Gaste aa on ecnysse in ealra worulda woruld, a butan ende. Amen.
